Miles Sound System SDK 6.6h

MILES_FILTER_DLS_FLAGS

The basic type MILES_FILTER_DLS_FLAGS specifies options to use when filtering DLS instrument sets with an XMIDI file.

Fundamental Values

 Value  Description
 AILFILTERDLS_USINGLIST This flag means that the XMI parameter doesn't point to XMIDI file, rather it points to a table of unsigned 32-bit integers with the following structure:

1st U32 - number of XMIDI files to filter with.
2nd U32 - pointer to the first XMIDI file image.
3rd U32 - pointer to the second XMIDI file image.
4th U32 - pointer to the third XMIDI file image.
... etc.

By using this flag, you can create an 'application-wide' DLS file - that is, a single DLS file that can play any XMIDI file in your application.


Group: Utility Services
Related Functions: AIL_filter_DLS_with_XMI
